correct: “Checkmate,” Rosaline announced with glee. She was getting to be really good at chess
incorrect: “Checkmate,” Rosaline announced with glee. She was getting to be really good at monopoly

correct: Justin put a second house on Park Place. He and his sister often spent hours playing monopoly
incorrect: Justin put a second house on Park Place. He and his sister often spent hours playing chess

correct: He caught the pass and scored another touchdown. There was nothing he enjoyed more than a good game of football
incorrect: He caught the pass and scored another touchdown. There was nothing he enjoyed more than a good game of baseball

correct: Rich couldn’t count the number of Yankees games he had seen with his father. They both shared a lifelong interest in baseball
incorrect: Rich couldn’t count the number of Yankees games he had seen with his father. They both shared a lifelong interest in football

correct: Getting both himself and his car to work on the neighboring island was time-consuming. Every morning he drove for a few minutes and then boarded the ferry
incorrect: Getting both himself and his car to work on the neighboring island was time-consuming. Every morning he drove for a few minutes and then boarded the canoe

correct: The patient was in critical condition and the ambulance wouldn’t be fast enough. They decided they would have to use the helicopter
incorrect: The patient was in critical condition and the ambulance wouldn’t be fast enough. They decided they would have to use the plane

correct: Amy was very anxious about traveling abroad for the first time. She felt surprisingly better, however, when she actually boarded the plane
incorrect: Amy was very anxious about traveling abroad for the first time. She felt surprisingly better, however, when she actually boarded the helicopter

correct: The day before the wedding, the kitchen was just covered with frosting. Annette’s sister was responsible for making the cake
incorrect: The day before the wedding, the kitchen was just covered with frosting. Annette’s sister was responsible for making the cookies

correct: The little girl was happy that Santa Claus left nothing but crumbs on the plate. She decided he must have really enjoyed the cookies
incorrect: The little girl was happy that Santa Claus left nothing but crumbs on the plate. She decided he must have really enjoyed the cake

correct: He wanted to make his wife breakfast, but he burned piece after piece. I couldn’t believe he was ruining even the toast
incorrect: He wanted to make his wife breakfast, but he burned piece after piece. I couldn’t believe he was ruining even the pancakes

correct: She keeps twirling it around and around under her collar. Stephanie seems really happy that Dan gave her that necklace
incorrect: She keeps twirling it around and around under her collar. Stephanie seems really happy that Dan gave her that bracelet

correct: She wanted to make her eyelashes look really black and thick. So she asked to borrow her older friend’s mascara
incorrect: She wanted to make her eyelashes look really black and thick. So she asked to borrow her older friend’s lipstick

correct: He complained that after she kissed him, he couldn’t get the red color off his face. He finally just asked her to stop wearing that lipstick
incorrect: He complained that after she kissed him, he couldn’t get the red color off his face. He finally just asked her to stop wearing that mascara

correct: Eleanor offered to fix her visitor some coffee. Then she realized she didn’t have a clean cup
incorrect: Eleanor offered to fix her visitor some coffee. Then she realized she didn’t have a clean bowl

correct: My aunt fixed my brother some cereal using her best china. Of course, the first thing he did was drop the bowl
incorrect: My aunt fixed my brother some cereal using her best china. Of course, the first thing he did was drop the cup

correct: At the dinner party, I wondered why my mother wasn’t eating her soup. Then I noticed that she didn’t have a spoon
incorrect: At the dinner party, I wondered why my mother wasn’t eating her soup. Then I noticed that she didn’t have a knife

correct: In the dorms, cutting your steak can be a huge struggle. They always give you such a poor quality knife
incorrect: In the dorms, cutting your steak can be a huge struggle. They always give you such a poor quality spoon

correct: He journeyed to the African plains, hoping to get a photograph of the king of the beasts. Unfortunately, the whole time he was there he never saw a lion
incorrect: He journeyed to the African plains, hoping to get a photograph of the king of the beasts. Unfortunately, the whole time he was there he never saw a tiger

correct: George was hiking in India when he saw the orange and black striped animal leap out at him. He sustained serious injuries before he managed to kill the tiger
incorrect: George was hiking in India when he saw the orange and black striped animal leap out at him. He sustained serious injuries before he managed to kill the lion

correct: Wendy wondered how they had managed to ship such a large animal all the way from China. She waited in line to see the newly acquired panda
incorrect: Wendy wondered how they had managed to ship such a large animal all the way from China. She waited in line to see the newly acquired otter

correct: Barb loved the feel of the waves on her feet, but she hated to walk barefoot. As a compromise, she usually wore a pair of sandals
incorrect: Barb loved the feel of the waves on her feet, but she hated to walk barefoot. As a compromise, she usually wore a pair of boots

correct: By the end of the day, the hiker’s feet were extremely cold and wet. It was the last time he would ever buy a cheap pair of boots
incorrect: By the end of the day, the hiker’s feet were extremely cold and wet. It was the last time he would ever buy a cheap pair of sandals

correct: Everyone agreed that the stone-washed kind were out of style. But he continued to wear the same old pair of jeans
incorrect: Everyone agreed that the stone-washed kind were out of style. But he continued to wear the same old pair of shorts

correct: As the afternoon progressed, it became hotter and hotter. Keith finally decided to put on a pair of shorts
incorrect: As the afternoon progressed, it became hotter and hotter. Keith finally decided to put on a pair of jeans

correct: Pablo wanted to cut the lumber he had bought to make some shelves. He asked his neighbor if he could borrow her saw
incorrect: Pablo wanted to cut the lumber he had bought to make some shelves. He asked his neighbor if he could borrow her hammer

correct: Tina lined up where she thought the nail should go. When she was satisfied, she asked Bruce to hand her the hammer
incorrect: Tina lined up where she thought the nail should go. When she was satisfied, she asked Bruce to hand her the saw

correct: The snow had piled up on the drive so high that they couldn’t get the car out. When Albert woke up, his father handed him a shovel
incorrect: The snow had piled up on the drive so high that they couldn’t get the car out. When Albert woke up, his father handed him a rake

correct: The yard was completely covered with a thick layer of dead leaves. Erica decided it was time to get out the rake
incorrect: The yard was completely covered with a thick layer of dead leaves. Erica decided it was time to get out the shovel

correct: Fred went to the pantry and got out the homemade jelly his grandmother had brought. Fifteen minutes later, however, he was still struggling to open the jar
incorrect: Fred went to the pantry and got out the homemade jelly his grandmother had brought. Fifteen minutes later, however, he was still struggling to open the box

correct: After they unpacked the new refrigerator, they let Billy have his fun. He played for days afterwards with the big box
incorrect: After they unpacked the new refrigerator, they let Billy have his fun. He played for days afterwards with the big jar

correct: It seemed to catch every time she opened or closed her backpack. She decided she would have to replace the zipper
incorrect: It seemed to catch every time she opened or closed her backpack. She decided she would have to replace the button

correct: One fell off her blouse and got lost, and she didn’t have any extras. She ended up searching all over town to find a matching button
incorrect: One fell off her blouse and got lost, and she didn’t have any extras. She ended up searching all over town to find a matching zipper

correct: “I’m an animal like Eeyore!” the child exclaimed. His mother wondered why he was pretending to be a donkey
incorrect: “I’m an animal like Eeyore!” the child exclaimed. His mother wondered why he was pretending to be a zebra

correct: At the zoo, my sister asked if they painted the black and white stripes on the animal. I explained to her that they were natural features of a zebra
incorrect: At the zoo, my sister asked if they painted the black and white stripes on the animal. I explained to her that they were natural features of a donkey
